property.name: include
property.value: Map:Common Data

property.name: description
property.value: Niko is confused by appearing here after a flash of light at the [[starting house]].

properties.property:
After exiting the "train" for the first time, a cutscene shows Niko looking east at a very tall structure on the horizon and puts them here.
After this, the [[fast travel]] tutorial [[note]] is also unlocked.

property.name: description
property.value: Every tile with x=28 make [[Prophetbot]] notice Niko. The camera will pan if the Prophetbot is off-screen then Prophetbot will say "Ah!" and move right and then up until Niko is 1 tile away. Then the proper encounter starts.

property.name: description
property.value: The (21, 23) tile and every tile below make [[Prophetbot]] turn around and notice Niko. The camera will pan if the Prophetbot is off-screen then Prophetbot will say "Ah!" and move down until Niko is on the same horizontal line and then 1 tile left. Then the proper encounter starts.

property.name: description
property.value: After opening the safe and walking back some [[squares]] appear and scare Niko.

properties.property:
Before giving Niko the [[coin]] that will help the [[Rowbot]] remember the way to the [[Glen]], [[Silver]] asks for a game of chess to which Niko agrees.
During the game, Silver opens up a bit about her history and explains that the cause of the sun's death was the decay of the world that won't stop after the sun is restored. Silver plays chess a lot with herself to pass the time so she easily wins the game.

property.name: description
property.value: The air in this area is too toxic for Niko to breathe without the [[gas mask]] equipped so they will exit it automatically.

property.name: description
property.value: The air in this area is too toxic for Niko to breathe without the [[gas mask]] equipped so they will exit it automatically.

properties.property:
The robot of the [[Prophet]], which was made to greet the messiah in their stead.
When [[Niko]] gets close, [[Prophetbot]] notices the [[lightbulb]] and approaches Niko, excited to answer any questions the savior from the prophecy might have.
Prophetbot can explain (all except "the computer" option are optional and can be skipped with Cancel key):
1) The history and regions of the [[world]] and the spire that housed the old sun.
2) The old and new [[sun]]s, the phosphor that stores their energy, and the reliance of the world on light for survival.
3) The computer saying the name of the [[player]], who is revealed to be the god of the world. The Prophetbot will teach Niko to communicate with the player directly. This presents an opportunity for the player to change their name. Prophetbot will also encourage Niko to look for the player's guidance.
4) Prophetbot doesn't know how Niko can go home, but their mission is to save the world.
After answering the questions Prophetbot wishes Niko luck and starts wandering aimlessly.

The Barrens' head engineer, that stayed when everyone else left the Barrens. Wanders aimlessly inside her cabin.
A bit mean to Niko, surprised by the fact the messiah is a cat-looking child, but otherwise helpful, willing to help Niko leave the Barrens. Has the [[coin]] neccessary to make the [[Rowbot]] remember the way to the [[Glen]].
Can explain the history of the [[spire]] and speculate that the force inside it is the Niko's way to return home.
She will try to read the [[weird journal]] if you give it to her but she can't.

A safe locked with a random 6 digit code which could be anything from 0 to 999999. The [[Entity]] will ask you to search for it in the Documents folder on your computer. The code is contained in the file "INFORMATION.oneshot.txt"
The safe contains the [[gas mask]] and the [[weird journal]]. When the gas mask is equipped using the Equipment menu, Niko's can explore the natural gas vents area. The journal has no relevance until [[Refuge]] but you can show it to [[Silver]]. If you havent picked up the [[boots]] opening the safe also unlocks the equipment tutorial [[note]].

<poem>''Recipe for a simple cleaning solvent'' ''<nowiki>*</nowiki>Note: wear hand protection''
''Reagents:'' ''-Arobigo gas'' ''-An emulsifier (any viscous liquid)''
''Steps:'' ''1) Place arobigo gas in a sealed container ''2) Without breaking the seal, inject emulsifier into container; shake vigorously.
''3) Use as soon as possible. ''If elements begin to seperate, further shaking is required.''</poem>

property.name: page
property.value: Bottle of acid

properties.property:
<poem>''I remember being taught in school ''about how the waters surrounding ''the forest stretched until the boundries ''of space.
''Of course, now they say it's the barrens. ''But I still wonder... ''What's beyond the void of the sheer cliffs? ''Is there a whole undiscovered world below us?
''I don't like thinking about it.</poem>
<poem>[[File:Niko.png]] There's a lot of tiny shrimp swimming in this jar.</poem>

<poem>''1. A robot may not injure a human being ''or, through inaction, allow a human being ''to come to harm.
''2. A robot must obey the orders given to ''it by human beings, except where such ''orders would conflict with the First Law.
''3. A robot must protect its own existence ''as long as such protection does not ''conflict with the First or Second Law. </poem>

property.name: description
property.value: ''SOLAR BATTERIES RESTOCKED''

properties.property:
<poem>''Natural Resources of The Barrens ''[harvesting locations]
''-Blue Phosphor '' -Mineral (Ubiquitous) '' -Organic/Biophosphor (Southeast) ''-Biophosphor sap (Southeast, uncommon)
''-Blue limestone (Ubiquitous) ''-Bauxite (North) ''-Iron ore (North) ''-Shale rock (North)
''-Arobigo Gas (Northwest) ''-
''...
''(the list goes on.)</poem>
<poem>[[File:Niko.png]] There's a lot of tiny shrimp swimming in this jar.</poem>
<poem>''Need extra cash? ''Start working at the cliffs today! ''Five positions available. ''First come, first serve.</poem>
<poem>[[File:Niko.png]] There's a lot of tiny shrimp swimming in this jar.</poem>
<poem>[[File:Niko.png]] There's a lot of tiny shrimp swimming in this jar.</poem>
<poem>[[File:Niko.png]] Light from this jar of shrimp is charging the battery.</poem>
<poem>[[File:Niko.png]] This appears to be a battery, but... It's too heavy to take...</poem>

<poem>''REVOLUTIONARY! ''SELF-CHARGING SOLAR BATTERY ''(5 year warranty included)
''Simply place your SELF-CHARGING BATTERY ''in full sunlight to charge at an incredible rate. ''No external power needed.</poem>

<poem>''XX/XX/XX
''Another miner fell into the abyss ''today.
''That's the THIRD this week. ''Maybe it's not much of a concern for ''you, but we need better safety ''conditions. This is unacceptable.
''Please tell that girl to hurry ''the hell up with those robots. ''We can't afford to lose any more ''men to easily preventable accidents.</poem>

<poem>''Hey sweetie,
''Six more weeks until you can come home! ''Are you excited?
''Surely you're sick of living in that awful ''capsule wall... thing! ''I bet you can't wait to sleep in a real bed and ''eat real food again!
''Write back soon!
''-love, mom.</poem>
<poem>[[File:Niko.png]] It's beyond repair...</poem>
<poem>[[File:Niko.png]] It looks like a solar panel. I think by just being near it, the lightbulb is powering these machines.</poem>
<poem>[[File:Niko.png]] It's labeled "mineral refinery".</poem>

<poem>''There's something weird about ''the robots who get sent to work ''near the vents.
''They always look... less rusty and ''shinier than even the newest models. ''Is that a result of the acid gas? Or am ''I just seeing things?</poem>

<poem>''XX/XX/XX
''Bah! "Destructive and unsustainable" my foot!
''Folks from the inner city complain about ''anything if they're bored to death in their nice ''comfty homes.
''Don't they know their city wouldn't be the way ''it is, if it weren't for this quarry?
''People seem to forget that The Barrens is ''a gift, and gifts aren't meant to just sit there ''and collect dust! ''Gifts need to be opened.</poem>

<poem>'' ''THE SAVIOR ''IS NOT ''COMING AND I AM
''AFRAID OF THE ''DARKNESS AND THE DARKNESS ''WILL ONLY GET ''DARKER
''AND DARKER AND ''DARKER
''TAKING MY LEAVE NOW. FAREWELL
''TO ALL
''I AM SO SORRY [[File:Niko.png]] ...</poem>
<poem>[[File:Niko.png]] It's beyond repair...</poem>
<poem>[[File:Niko.png]] It's beyond repair...</poem>
<poem>[[File:Niko.png]] It's beyond repair...</poem>

<poem>[[File:Niko.png]] There's a lot of tiny shrimp swimming in this jar.</poem>
<poem>[[File:Niko.png]] There's a lot of tiny shrimp swimming in this jar.</poem>
<poem>[[File:Niko.png]] There's a lot of tiny shrimp swimming in this jar.</poem>
<poem>[[File:Niko.png]] A chess set. Guess it must be pretty boring here to be alone.</poem>

<poem>''The amount of noxious fumes emitted by the ''natural gas vents caught our team off-guard. ''With such a high concentration, it seemed ''impossible that anything with lungs could exist.
''It remained quite a mystery until our ''scientists realized the shrimp scattered ''in the pools were actually consuming it.
''Without those shrimp, life wouldn't be. ''It's kind of depressing to think that we ''can't thank them.
''Still, we wore masks to be safe, especially ''around active vent sites. ''The replacement of our workforce by robots ''soon rendered masks unecessary.
''I wonder what happened to them all? ''I can't even remember where I placed mine.</poem>

<poem>''Dear Silver,
''I heard the news about the mine. ''I can't imagine what you're feeling.
''It's been two weeks. ''I know it must be hard, but you ''must leave soon too. It's only a matter ''of time before the rowbots are recalled.
''At least let me know you ''got my message, okay?
''-Kip</poem>
<poem>[[File:Niko.png]] The horizon glows a faint green.</poem>
<poem>[[File:Niko.png]] The horizon glows a faint green.</poem>

property.name: description
property.value: The boots are found here. When they are equipped using the Equipment menu, Niko's moves at a much higher speed. If you havent opened the safe it also unlocks the equipment tutorial [[note]].

property.name: description
property.value: A small blue glimmer shines on a shelf. It is a screwdriver that can be combined with the [[camera]] to get the [[lens]] out of it. It can be picked up from both sides of the shelf.

property.name: description
property.value: A locked box with a small flickering sun symbol on its side. Contains a broken solar battery. Can be opened using the [[crowbar]].

property.name: page
property.value: Broken battery

property.name: description
property.value: A metal rod is found here. It can be used on the "garbage compactor" machine at the Dormitories to make the [[crowbar]].

property.name: page
property.value: Metal rod

property.name: description
property.value: A cleaning sponge is found here. It can be combined with the [[bottle of acid]] to make the [[wet sponge]] if the [[rubber gloves]] are equipped.

property.name: description
property.value: A pond full of biophosphor sap. The sap liquid is viscous enough to be used as emulsifier for the cleaning solution recipe described on a note inside the [[Outpost]]. You can fill the [[empty syringe]] with sap to make the viscous syringe which can be combined with the [[bottle of smoke]] to make the [[bottle of acid]].

property.name: page
property.value: Viscous syringe

property.name: description
property.value: A pair of rubber gloves is found here. When they are equipped using the Equipment menu, Niko can combine the [[sponge]] with the [[bottle of acid]] and use the resulting [[wet sponge]] to clean the [[Rowbot]].

property.name: page
property.value: Rubber gloves

properties.property: A garbage compactor machine specifically designed for heavy-duty crushing of metals. Can be used to turn the [[metal rod]] into a [[crowbar]] which can open the box inside the Outpost.

property.name: description
property.value: A broken camera is found here. It can be combined with the [[screwdriver]] to get the [[lens]].

property.name: description
property.value: A box containing broken and rusted medical tools. Niko will take a plastic [[empty syringe]] from it and the box will disappear. The syringe can be filled with viscous liquid of the [[shrimp swamp]] bubble pond to get the [[viscous syringe]].

property.name: page
property.value: Empty syringe

property.name: description
property.value: A small Arobigo gas vent Niko can reach. The [[empty bottle]] can be filled with the gas here to make the [[bottle of smoke]] for the cleaning solution recipe described on a note inside the [[Outpost]].

property.name: page
property.value: Bottle of smoke

property.name: description
property.value: Tiles (23, 58), (33, 58) and every tile in-between trigger fade-to-black transition to the dock map if Niko is facing down.

property.name: description
property.value: Every tile with y=12 triggers fade-to-black transition to the vents map if Niko is facing up.

property.name: description
property.value: Every tile with x=58 triggers fade-to-black transition to the quarry/mining facility map if Niko is facing right.

property.name: description
property.value: Every tile with x=12 triggers fade-to-black transition to the vents map if Niko is facing left.

property.name: description
property.value: Every tile with x=58 triggers fade-to-black transition to the cliffs map if Niko is facing right.

property.value: Every tile with x=12 triggers fade-to-black transition to the quarry/mining facility map if Niko is facing left.

property.name: description
property.value: Every tile with y=58 triggers fade-to-black transition to the hotel/dormitories map if Niko is facing down.

property.name: description
property.value: Every tile with y=12 triggers fade-to-black transition to the cliffs map if Niko is facing up.

property.name: description
property.value: Every tile with y=68 triggers fade-to-black transition to the shrimp swamp map if Niko is facing down.

property.name: description
property.value: Every tile with y=12 triggers fade-to-black transition to the hotel/dormitories map if Niko is facing up.

property.name: description

property.name: description

property.value: Every tile with x=58 triggers fade-to-black transition to the outpost map if Niko is facing right.

property.name: description
property.value: Every tile with y=68 triggers fade-to-black transition to the train/roadways map if Niko is facing down.

property.name: description
property.value: Every tile with y=12 triggers fade-to-black transition to the dock map if Niko is facing up.

properties.property:
Rowbot #310, unpowered, rusty and circuits fried. Needs to be powered by the [[charged battery]], cleaned with the [[wet sponge]] and reminded where the [[Glen]] is with the [[coin]] to be able to transport Niko there. Niko also needs to sleep at least once to proceed.
When the Rowbot is unpowered you get an opportunity to prank Niko by saying you're not here.

property.name: description
property.value: Equipping the [[gas mask]] is required to use this fast travel point.

object.name: Before any fast travel in any zone Niko gets placed here

properties.property:
Allows to quit the game without killing Niko. Meeting the [[Prophetbot]] is required to use this bed. Interacting with this bed unlocks the "Saving the game" [[note]].
Using this bed at least once is required to leave the Barrens. The bed can be used any amount of times. Using beds unequips all equipped items except the [[boots]].
After the first time sleeping in this bed Niko will have a dream about the wheat field surrounding their home village. Niko will be excited to tell you more about their home and will ask you about yours.
